table.style: border: 0px; font-size: 11px; font-family: verdana; vertical-align: top;

tr.style: border: 1px #F0F0F0 solid; font-size: 11px; font-family: verdana; vertical-align: top;

a.title: The logical name of the element
Information about the use of the element
Minimum and Maximum # of times the the element can appear in the instance
Reference to the type of the element
Additional information about the element
Legend for this format

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/zQHDfzoAAJg0xzGxXiQ9AAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

a.title: Timing : Specifies an event that may occur multiple times. Timing schedules are used to record when things are expected or requested to occur. The most common usage is in dosage instructions for medications. They are also used when planning care of various kinds.

tr.td: A timing schedule that specifies an event that may occur multiple times

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/zQHDfzoAAJg0xzGxXiQ9AAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

a.title: Timing.event : Identifies specific times when the event occurs.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/zQHDfzoAAJg0xzGxXiQ9AAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

a.title: Timing.repeat : A set of rules that describe when the event should occur.

span.title: This element has or is affected by some invariants

tr.td:
When the event is to occur
Either frequency or when can exist, not both
if there's a duration, there needs to be duration units
if there's a period, there needs to be duration units
If there's a periodMax, there must be a period
If there's a durationMax, there must be a duration

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAE0lEQVR42mP4/x0IaQwY/tMBAACSBMcpuec9bgAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)

a.title: Timing.repeat.bounds : Outer bounds for start and/or end limits of the timing schedule.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAE0lEQVR42mP4/x0IaQwY/tMBAACSBMcpuec9bgAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)

a.title: Timing.repeat.count : A total count of the desired number of repetitions.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAE0lEQVR42mP4/x0IaQwY/tMBAACSBMcpuec9bgAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)

a.title: Timing.repeat.duration : How long this thing happens for when it happens.

span.title: This element has or is affected by some invariants

tr.td:
How long when it happens
duration SHALL be a non-negative value

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAE0lEQVR42mP4/x0IaQwY/tMBAACSBMcpuec9bgAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)

a.title: Timing.repeat.durationUnits : The units of time for the duration, in UCUM units.

tr.td:
s | min | h | d | wk | mo | a - unit of time (UCUM)
UnitsOfTime ( Required)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAE0lEQVR42mP4/x0IaQwY/tMBAACSBMcpuec9bgAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)

a.title: Timing.repeat.frequency : The number of times to repeat the action within the specified period / period range (i.e. both period and periodMax provided).

tr.td: Event occurs frequency times per duration

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAE0lEQVR42mP4/x0IaQwY/tMBAACSBMcpuec9bgAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)

a.title: Timing.repeat.frequencyMax : If present, indicates that the frequency is a range - so repeat between [frequency] and [frequencyMax] times within the period or period range.

tr.td: Event occurs frequency times per duration

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAE0lEQVR42mP4/x0IaQwY/tMBAACSBMcpuec9bgAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)

a.title: Timing.repeat.period : Indicates the duration of time over which repetitions are to occur. E.g. to express "3 times per day", 3 would be the frequency and "1 day" would be the period.

span.title: This element has or is affected by some invariants

tr.td:
Event occurs frequency times per period
period SHALL be a non-negative value

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAE0lEQVR42mP4/x0IaQwY/tMBAACSBMcpuec9bgAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)

a.title: Timing.repeat.periodMax : If present, indicates that the period is a range from [period] to [periodMax], allowing expressing concepts such as "do this once every 3-5 days.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAE0lEQVR42mP4/x0IaQwY/tMBAACSBMcpuec9bgAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)

a.title: Timing.repeat.periodUnits : The units of time for the period in UCUM units.

tr.td:
s | min | h | d | wk | mo | a - unit of time (UCUM)
UnitsOfTime ( Required)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/zQHDfzoAAJg0xzGxXiQ9AAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

a.title: Timing.repeat.when : A real world event that the occurrence of the event should be tied to.

tr.td:
Regular life events the event is tied to
EventTiming ( Required)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAD0lEQVR42mP4TwfAQA9LAJ50xzkA9NE0AAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

a.title: Timing.code : A code for the timing pattern. Some codes such as BID are uniquitious, but many instutions define their own additional codes.

tr.td:
BID | TID | QID | AM | PM +
TimingAbbreviation ( Preferred)

requirements.value: Need to able to track proposed timing schedules. There are several different ways to do this: one or more specified times, a simple rules like three times a day, or before/after meals.

short.value: A timing schedule that specifies an event that may occur multiple times

definition.value: Specifies an event that may occur multiple times. Timing schedules are used to record when things are expected or requested to occur. The most common usage is in dosage instructions for medications. They are also used when planning care of various kinds.

comments.value: A timing schedule can be either a list of events - intervals on which the event occurs, or a single event with repeating criteria or just repeating criteria with no actual event. When both event and a repeating specification are provided, the list of events should be understood as an interpretation of the information in the repeat structure.

requirements.value: Need to able to track proposed timing schedules. There are several different ways to do this: one or more specified times, a simple rules like three times a day, or before/after meals.

short.value: xml:id (or equivalent in JSON)

definition.value: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

short.value: Additional Content defined by implementations

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comments.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

short.value: When the event occurs

definition.value: Identifies specific times when the event occurs.

requirements.value: In an MAR, for instance, you need to take a general specification, and turn it into a precise specification.

short.value: When the event is to occur

definition.value: A set of rules that describe when the event should occur.

requirements.value: Many timing schedules are determined by regular repetitions.

human.value: Either frequency or when can exist, not both
if there's a duration, there needs to be duration units
if there's a period, there needs to be duration units
If there's a periodMax, there must be a period
If there's a durationMax, there must be a duration

short.value: xml:id (or equivalent in JSON)

definition.value: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

short.value: Additional Content defined by implementations

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comments.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

short.value: Start and/or end limits

definition.value: Outer bounds for start and/or end limits of the timing schedule.

short.value: Number of times to repeat

definition.value: A total count of the desired number of repetitions.

comments.value: If you have both bounds and count, then this should be understand as within the bounds period, until count times happens.

requirements.value: Repetitions may be limited by end time or total occurrences.

short.value: How long when it happens

definition.value: How long this thing happens for when it happens.

comments.value: For some events the duration is part of the definition of the event (e.g. IV infusions). For others, it's part of the timing specification (e.g. exercise).

requirements.value: Some activities are not instantaneous and need to be maintained for a period of time.

human.value: duration SHALL be a non-negative value

short.value: s | min | h | d | wk | mo | a - unit of time (UCUM)

definition.value: The units of time for the duration, in UCUM units.

description.value: A unit of time (units from UCUM)

short.value: Event occurs frequency times per duration

definition.value: The number of times to repeat the action within the specified period / period range (i.e. both period and periodMax provided).

short.value: Event occurs frequency times per duration

definition.value: If present, indicates that the frequency is a range - so repeat between [frequency] and [frequencyMax] times within the period or period range.

short.value: Event occurs frequency times per period

definition.value: Indicates the duration of time over which repetitions are to occur. E.g. to express "3 times per day", 3 would be the frequency and "1 day" would be the period.

human.value: period SHALL be a non-negative value

short.value: Upper limit of period (3-4 hours)

definition.value: If present, indicates that the period is a range from [period] to [periodMax], allowing expressing concepts such as "do this once every 3-5 days.

short.value: s | min | h | d | wk | mo | a - unit of time (UCUM)

definition.value: The units of time for the period in UCUM units.

description.value: A unit of time (units from UCUM)

short.value: Regular life events the event is tied to

definition.value: A real world event that the occurrence of the event should be tied to.

requirements.value: Timings are frequently determined by occurrences such as waking, eating and sleep.

description.value: Real world event that the schedule relates to

short.value: BID | TID | QID | AM | PM +

definition.value: A code for the timing pattern. Some codes such as BID are uniquitious, but many instutions define their own additional codes.

comments.value: A repeat should always be defined except for the common codes BID, TID, QID, AM and PM, which all systems are required to understand.

description.value: Code for a known / defined timing pattern

short.value: A timing schedule that specifies an event that may occur multiple times

definition.value: Specifies an event that may occur multiple times. Timing schedules are used to record when things are expected or requested to occur. The most common usage is in dosage instructions for medications. They are also used when planning care of various kinds.

comments.value: A timing schedule can be either a list of events - intervals on which the event occurs, or a single event with repeating criteria or just repeating criteria with no actual event. When both event and a repeating specification are provided, the list of events should be understood as an interpretation of the information in the repeat structure.

requirements.value: Need to able to track proposed timing schedules. There are several different ways to do this: one or more specified times, a simple rules like three times a day, or before/after meals.

short.value: When the event occurs

definition.value: Identifies specific times when the event occurs.

requirements.value: In an MAR, for instance, you need to take a general specification, and turn it into a precise specification.

short.value: When the event is to occur

definition.value: A set of rules that describe when the event should occur.

requirements.value: Many timing schedules are determined by regular repetitions.

human.value: Either frequency or when can exist, not both
if there's a duration, there needs to be duration units
if there's a period, there needs to be duration units
If there's a periodMax, there must be a period
If there's a durationMax, there must be a duration

short.value: Start and/or end limits

definition.value: Outer bounds for start and/or end limits of the timing schedule.

short.value: Number of times to repeat

definition.value: A total count of the desired number of repetitions.

comments.value: If you have both bounds and count, then this should be understand as within the bounds period, until count times happens.

requirements.value: Repetitions may be limited by end time or total occurrences.

definition.value: How long this thing happens for when it happens.

comments.value: For some events the duration is part of the definition of the event (e.g. IV infusions). For others, it's part of the timing specification (e.g. exercise).

requirements.value: Some activities are not instantaneous and need to be maintained for a period of time.

definition.value: The units of time for the duration, in UCUM units.

description.value: A unit of time (units from UCUM)

definition.value: The number of times to repeat the action within the specified period / period range (i.e. both period and periodMax provided).

short.value: Event occurs frequency times per duration

definition.value: If present, indicates that the frequency is a range - so repeat between [frequency] and [frequencyMax] times within the period or period range.

definition.value: Indicates the duration of time over which repetitions are to occur. E.g. to express "3 times per day", 3 would be the frequency and "1 day" would be the period.

short.value: Upper limit of period (3-4 hours)

definition.value: If present, indicates that the period is a range from [period] to [periodMax], allowing expressing concepts such as "do this once every 3-5 days.

definition.value: A code for the timing pattern. Some codes such as BID are uniquitious, but many instutions define their own additional codes.

comments.value: A repeat should always be defined except for the common codes BID, TID, QID, AM and PM, which all systems are required to understand.
